alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Mountains; Los Angeles County San Fernando Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 4:33AM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following areas, Antelope Valley, Los Angeles County Beaches, Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles, Los Angeles County Mountains, Los Angeles County San Fernando Valley, Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley, Malibu Coast, Santa Clarita Valley and Santa Monica Mountains. * WHEN...From this evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying areas. Rock slides and mud slides may become a significant problem. While there is a chance of main stem river flooding, water flowing through normally dry rivers and washes will threaten homeless encampments, including on the Los Angeles River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong Pacific storm system will bring periods of widespread heavy rainfall with rates between one half and one inch per hour, possibly higher near thunderstorms and favored foothill areas. Rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches are expected in coastal and valley areas, with 4 to 8 inches expected in the foothills and mountains. Local rainfall totals of 10 inches are possible. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Mountains; Los Angeles County San Fernando Valley
